snippet: Almost a quarter of journalists from Syria have been forced into exile since 2010, a leading press advocacy group said in a report released Wednesday.
abstract: Committee to Protect Journalists reports at least 452 journalists worldwide were forced into exile since 2010, with 101 from Syria, 57 from Ethiopia and 52 from Iran; attributes Syria's majority to threat of government reprisals and attacks by militant groups.
lead_paragraph: Almost a quarter of journalists from Syria have been forced into exile since 2010, a leading press advocacy group said in a report released Wednesday.

headline.main: Hundreds of Journalists Exiled Globally, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Hundreds of Journalists Exiled Globally, With 1 in 4 From Syria, Report Says
